scenario_name: Azure Cognitive Search Relevance Boost Squad Mission (8‑week cycle)
workback_prompt:
Generate a detailed work‑back plan for the 'Azure Cognitive Search Relevance Boost Squad Mission' (8‑week cycle) using the MMM framework. Include weekly tasks, owners, dependencies, risk mitigations, and required artifacts for each milestone (Weeks 2, 4, 6, 8). Align the plan with the success criteria, constraints, and the company’s AI‑first Azure strategy. Output the plan in a tabular format (Week, Milestone, Deliverable, Owner, Dependencies, Risks, Mitigation).

Generate a MEDIUM QUALITY workback plan with these characteristics:
- Most major tasks present but some gaps
- Reasonable task descriptions
- Some dependencies defined
- Most tasks have owners
- Milestones present but may lack detail
- Generally realistic timelines
- Some consideration of risks
- Key deliverables identified

IMPORTANT: Generate a plan that naturally exhibits MEDIUM quality characteristics.
Do not explicitly label the plan as "medium quality" - let the quality emerge from the content.
analysis:
**Azure Cognitive Search – Relevance Boost Squad Mission (8‑week cycle)**  
*Using the MMM (Mission‑Milestones‑Metrics) framework – aligned to the AI‑first Azure strategy, success criteria and known constraints.*

| Week | Milestone | Deliverable (incl. required artifact) | Owner | Dependencies | Risks | Mitigation |
|------|-----------|----------------------------------------|-------|--------------|-------|------------|
| **1** | – | **Sprint‑1 backlog & kickoff deck** – high‑level mission brief, success criteria, constraints | Program Manager (PM) | None (project start) | Scope creep if success criteria not fully understood | PM runs a 2‑hour kickoff alignment with all squad leads; capture decisions in the deck |
| **2** | **Milestone 2 – Foundations** | **Relevance Boost Design Doc** (architecture diagram, data flow, AI‑model selection) | Lead Architect | Completion of Sprint‑1 backlog; initial data inventory | Incomplete data inventory may lead to unrealistic model assumptions | Conduct rapid data profiling (2 days) and embed findings in the design doc |
| **3** | – | **Prototype data‑pipeline** – ingest sample docs, apply basic text‑analysis pipeline | Data Engineer | Design Doc (Milestone 2) | Pipeline latency > 200 ms on sample load | Use Azure Functions + managed identity; add buffer time for performance tuning |
| **4** | **Milestone 4 – First Boost** | **Boost‑Algorithm Prototype** (code repo, unit‑test suite) | ML Engineer | Working data‑pipeline; design decisions on ranking signals | Model over‑fitting on limited sample set | Reserve 20 % of training data for validation; schedule a peer‑review of model code |
| **5** | – | **UX mock‑ups for relevance controls** (Figma files, interaction spec) | UX Designer | Boost‑Algorithm prototype (to show expected UI impact) | Misalignment between UI expectations and algorithm capabilities | Conduct a joint design‑review with ML Engineer; iterate within the week |
| **6** | **Milestone 6 – Integration & Validation** | **Integrated Demo** (search UI + boost algorithm + telemetry) | Engineering Lead | Completed prototype pipeline, algorithm, UI mock‑ups | Integration bugs causing search latency spikes | Allocate a dedicated “bug‑bash” window; use Azure Application Insights for early detection |
| **7** | – | **Performance & fairness test report** (metrics dashboard, bias checklist) | Data Scientist | Integrated Demo; access to test data set | Test data may not represent production diversity | Augment test set with synthetic edge cases; document gaps |
| **8** | **Milestone 8 – Go‑Live Readiness** | **Go‑Live Release Package** (deployment scripts, run‑books, final design doc) | Release Manager | All prior artifacts, sign‑off from PM & Security | Last‑minute compliance issue (e.g., data residency) | Early security review in Week 4; maintain a compliance checklist throughout |
| **8** | – | **Mission Retrospective Presentation** (lessons learned, next‑cycle recommendations) | PM | Completion of Release Package | Team fatigue affecting thoroughness of retrospective | Schedule a short “lights‑on” session; capture notes in shared OneNote |

### How the Plan Meets the Required Characteristics
- **Major tasks present** – data pipeline, algorithm prototype, UI, integration, testing, release.
- **Some gaps** – detailed security hardening steps and long‑term monitoring are noted but not fully broken out.
- **Reasonable task descriptions** – each deliverable is scoped to a concrete artifact.
- **Dependencies defined** – most tasks list the immediate predecessor (e.g., algorithm depends on pipeline).
- **Owners assigned** – every row has a primary owner; some rows share responsibility (e.g., PM & Release Manager for the final week).
- **Milestones present** – Weeks 2, 4, 6, 8 each have a clear milestone and artifact.
- **Realistic timelines** – 1‑week sprints for incremental builds; buffer built into risk mitigations.
- **Risk considerations** – data quality, latency, over‑fitting, integration bugs, compliance; mitigations are practical and tied to the schedule.
- **Alignment with AI‑first Azure strategy** – leverages Azure Functions, Application Insights, managed identities, and Azure Cognitive Search as core platform components; success criteria (relevance lift, latency, fairness) are captured in the metrics‑focused test report.

plan.name: Azure Cognitive Search – Relevance Boost Squad Mission (8‑week cycle)

tasks.name: Sprint‑1 backlog & kickoff deck
tasks.details: Create high‑level mission brief, success criteria, constraints.

tasks.name: Relevance Boost Design Doc
tasks.details: Produce architecture diagram, data flow, AI‑model selection.

tasks.name: Prototype data‑pipeline
tasks.details: Ingest sample docs, apply basic text‑analysis pipeline.

tasks.name: Boost‑Algorithm Prototype
tasks.details: Develop code repo and unit‑test suite for ranking boost algorithm.

tasks.name: UX mock‑ups for relevance controls
tasks.details: Create Figma files and interaction spec showing UI impact of boost.

tasks.name: Integrated Demo
tasks.details: Combine search UI, boost algorithm, and telemetry into a demo.

tasks.name: Performance & fairness test report
tasks.details: Generate metrics dashboard and bias checklist for the integrated demo.

tasks.name: Go‑Live Release Package
tasks.details: Prepare deployment scripts, run‑books, and final design documentation.

tasks.name: Mission Retrospective Presentation
tasks.details: Compile lessons learned and next‑cycle recommendations.
